 Welcome Letter From Interim Chief John Freese 
 
 
 
 
 
   
   
 Welcome to the official website of the University of California Riverside Police Department. The UCR Police Department was established in 1954 on this campus. The Police Department is a professional police agency staffed by individuals who cherish and preserve the highest standards of conduct and performance. 
 The mission of our department is to heighten the quality of life on campus by providing a safe and secure environment through professional service to the University community.  In order to be successful in this mission, we need to maintain the public's trust and pursue a partnership with our community.  Please contact me with any feedback you have on our service.

 Active Shooter & Crisis Response 
 
 UCPD offers a Crisis Response Course that guides Faculty, Staff, and Students on how to respond in an active shooter incident. The course will utilize the "RAIN" acronym (Respond, Assess, Isolate, and Notify) and the "Run, Hide, Fight" response tactic video for active shooter incidents. 
 To register:  
 Go to the UC Learning Center at  www.ucrlearning.ucr.edu 
 Click Login Now 
 Enter your UCR NetID and password* 
 Type in "RAIN" in the search field and click Go 
 Click on "Responding to a Crisis Situation", and select Register 
 Review the activity details and select Submit to complete your registration 
 If you can't attend our Crisis Response Course, please click on the video below to watch the UCPD Crisis Response Presentation, which includes the Run, Hide, Fight video. This video will provide you with basic response strategies that can help you survive an active shooter incident. 
 Click Here For Video

 What To Do 
 
 
 
 
 
 
            Respond     
            -Dont freeze up 
-Find out what's happening 
-Identify the source of disturbance     
            Assess     
            - Suspects and Weapons 
- Status of Victims 
- Note your location     
            Isolate     
            -Run: Evacuate if safe 
-Hide: Shelter in place if you cannot evacuate 
-Fight: As a last report act with aggression and commit to taking over the shooter     
            Notify     
            Notify: -Call 911 when it is safe 
-Utilize panic buttons 
-Text message a friend or family member     Previous Next
